quote: Indeed!
We came here in peace, and we intend to go in one... piece.
In the middle of my backswing?!
I have great confidence in you, Carter. Go on back to the SGC and confuse Hammond.
It's always suicide-mission this, save-the-planet that... No one ever stops by just to say 'hi' anymore.
I guess I'm supposed to say something... profound... Nothing comes to mind. Let's do it.
Not waving; pointing.
Holy frozen bad guys.
If we don't find a way out of this soon, I'm going to lose it... WACKO!
O'Neill—Two Ls.
I can see my house!
Hammond is insisting SG-1 needs a sociopolitical nerd to offset our overwhelming coolness.
General Hammond, request permission to beat the crap outta this man.
Ba'al, c'mon. You should know. Of course I dare mock you.
You ended that sentence with a preposition... bastard!
Isn't it amazing how nature arranges for the crackpots to find each other.
I'm hiding. What's yours?
Okey-dokey. We surrender.
She's a mother; that's close enough.
Shut up! Shut up! You're hostages. This is a life and death situation here. Start acting like it.
I don't stop trying until I'm dead... and sometimes not even then.
Just because my reproductive organs are on the inside doesn’t mean I can’t handle whatever you can handle.
You blow up one sun and suddenly everyone expects you to walk on water.
Next step, parting the Red Sea!
It's beer, isn't it?
Undomesticated equines could not remove me.
Things will not calm down, Daniel Jackson. They will, in fact, calm up.
You have been impregnated without copulation.
My depth is immaterial to this conversation.
A Serpent guard, a Horus guard and a Setesh guard meet on a neutral planet. The Serpent guard’s eyes glow. The Horus guard’s beak glistens. The Setesh guard’s nose drips.
In my culture, I would be well within my rights to dismember you.
We die well, Teal'c.
More than that, my friend. We die free.
I have spent 133 years worshipping false gods. No more!
O'Neill suggested I send you to a distant planet for your actions here, but I am reasonably certain his statement was in jest.
Earth is now part of the Protected Planets Treaty.
I will not allow Earth to face annihilation.
If I'm gonna die, I'd rather go out doing something important.
Kneel before your god, shol'va!
You dare mock me?
It's good to be king.
Chevron seven, locked!
If you immediately know the candlelight is fire, then the meal was cooked a long time ago.
Never in the history of boredom has anyone been more bored than I am right now.
We're finally gonna see the Furlings!
Last time I was this bored, I took hostages.
I'm a constant source of disappointment to myself.
Yeah, let’s make babies!
SG-1, you have a go.
Nobody's perfect. Everyone has some sort of character flaw. What's yours?
I just want to be given the opportunity to prove I can make a difference.
You go off-world, you come back naked; that's fine. But you break my heart, I will not forgive you.
Not to mention a really nice DeLorean.
Had the Wraith attended the Geneva Convention, they'd have tried to feed on everyone there.
Life isn't fair; it's just fairer than death.
You know, this is not a good way to make new friends!
Get as far away from the nuclear explosion as possible. That's good advice, Rodney, thanks.
Please, I'm Rodney McKay. Difficult takes a few seconds; impossible, a few minutes.
I'm invulnerable!
I passed out from... manly hunger!
You're right. If only we had a magical tool that could slow down time. I foolishly left mine on Earth—did you bring yours?
95% of deadly is still deadly!
We've got slow death, quick death, painful death, cold, lonely death.
You destroyed three-quarters of a solar system!
Did I mention that I know almost everything about almost everything?
What am I, MacGyver? Fix it with what?
I'm going to curl up in bed with the largest sandwich I can find.
Atlantis is far more than shelter; it is hope.
You kill him before I do, I kill you.
Whoever it is, they're going to have tough shoes to fill.
I'm a doctor, not a bloody fighter pilot!
We're in another galaxy. How much more out can you get?
Dry mouth, headache, the irresistible urge to run on a small wheel...
Well, I'd like to know just one thing: Why do these things always seem to happen to me?
I believe that makes us even, John Sheppard.
How'd it go back on Earth?
It's not gonna be the same round here without you.
You know, the universe is a big place. Who knows, maybe we'll bump into each other again.
Do you have any idea how many gate addresses there are in the Ancient database that have no accompanying description?
It's not like we're dating!
Fish in a pond, busy busy, lots to do, here and there.
No. But the IOA believes it could be an important first step toward interplanetary government. A 'federation', if you will.
Their operating system is a mess, thank goodness I remember DOS.
O'Neill. I am dying.
My heart bleeds for you.
You lie poorly.
Can't help you there. That's between you and your god. Oh, wait a minute. You are your god. That's a problem.
Basically he was the original Satan.
The people of Chulak no longer worship you. They no longer fear you. The time of Apophis has come to an end.
Then kill me now!
That time is no more.
I am afraid.
There's a pulse.
It has a heartbeat?
It has a heart?
Bug spray?
Robot-denial?
I don't like most of what you say but I try to resist the urge to shove you through a wall.
This is boring.
I'm starting to identify with this girl more and more.
Yes, sir, we may have a Replicator situation down here. I suggest sealing the base and doing a clean sweep. Yes, sir. And we also have a robot on the loose.
You stupid son of a bitch.
You're welcome.
They didn't stop because you shot her. They stopped because she told them to.
Carter said she was losing control. Now if just one of those damn things got out of this base, developed its own personality, we would be royally screwed.
So, T, who you taking in the Cup? Lord Stanley's Cup? Hockey? Remember, with the ice and the skating.
Indeed. I believe the Canucks of Vancouver are superior warriors.
Canucks, eh?
What, you're counting?
I'm not a soldier! I teach applied math at Yale! I have a Vespa and two cats!
How come you're not smiling?
Should I be?
Well, it is your first time being captured by a Goa'uld.
Bite me, Coombs! At least my heroes exist.
VULCAN! FELGER! VULCAN! And I don't know how you can call yourself a scientist and not worship at the altar of Roddenberry.
Carter, be honest, the résumé gag?
It needs work, O'Neill.
Won't be long.
My name is K'tano. The once First Prime of Imhotep. A false god who has died by my own hand.
Deliverance. Do you have any idea what happened to the guys in that movie?
Well that's fine, as long as it's a really big number.
Yes, which is why I don't say much.
You have a problem with dying or you have a problem with the fact that they don't have a problem with dying?
Well, he knows stupid!
I die free.
The rat bastard.
I thought he came across as very nice.
The voice behind the camera.
You don't think it's possible for an NID operative to lie?
I believe it is, Daniel Jackson.
I'll say this again. I don't like the thought of going into this unarmed.
And... I don't care.
I feel better just knowing there's an archaeologist watching our backs.
Yeah, which end do the bullets go in again?
Our mission objective is to fix whatever you screwed up. If you get any ideas other than that, I'll shoot you. Understood?
Just out of curiosity, how many years did you promise to take off their sentence if they managed to fix this?
Actually they'll get a few more years out of this.
More?
They were on Death Row.
So how did you manage to find the Sentinel if the Latonans didn't want to show it to you?
Maybe we're good?
Bribed the locals, eh?
I see you've done your homework.
The Sentinel was indeed a device with great power. It would be wise to ask the Latonans to study it further.
Oh, I think I know what they'd say.
Obviously, this is very confusing at first glance.
Oh, no, no, no. What could be more clear? There were two different sorts of alien ships. I follow completely.
I am a bit dubious that not one but two reported meteors in the last few years were in fact alien ships.
Actually, there were three.
It is the opinion of the Asgard High Council that Stargate Command should be left in the very capable hands of General Hammond and his team.
And while our continued friendship with Earth is not contingent on that, it is preferred.
We will be vastly outnumbered by Ba'al's forces.
I refuse to consider a strategy that demands the deliberate sacrifice of Jaffa lives.
What then do you advocate, prayer perhaps?
All of the hardship, the suffering, the sacrifices we have made for our cause will end today one way or another. This battle will decide the fate of all Jaffa.
This is madness.
So too at one time was the very thought of our freedom.
It's not just processing the information, it's understanding it at a whole different level which you are not capable of.
Because you're a machine.
That's where you're wrong.
Use two of those things.
It's a 'Blast Door!'
I expect to be put in your will!
Already in it, Sir!
OK, that's... weird.
Surrender and you will be granted mercy.
You are in no position to make such ridiculous demands. You are surrounded.
On the contrary, it is you who are surrounded by free Jaffa.
Behold, your false god!
Wonder what they'll do to us? Feed on us, probably. I mean, that's what they do.
It's not gonna come to that.
I wonder what'd be worse: being life-sucked by the Wraith or burned alive.
Stop talking.
OK, you know what? Make me!
Thanks, it'll be a walk in the park. A very scary park, filled with monsters who are trying to kill me.
Operation: This Will Most Likely End Badly is a go.
So what do they really want?
To point fingers, and cover their asses.
They're bureaucrats, Elizabeth. You'll eat them for breakfast.
Sorry, got the wrong number!
Success is not final. Failure is not fatal. It is the courage to continue that counts. And I think you've got that in spades.
Churchill?
Yeah. Except for that last part about you. That was all me.
Their operating system is a mess... thank goodness I remember DOS. Trust me, that was hilarious.
What the hell do they want?
Maybe they want to surrender.
Not likely. Let's hear it.
Don't get all emotional on me now.
It didn't work on her.
Oh. Beckett wondered if the females would be immune.
Something you might have mentioned before she almost killed me, Rodney.
I only thought of it now.
You go first.
Take no offense there, Skippy. I'm sure you're a real hot, important Goa'uld. I've just always been kinda out of the loop with the snake thing.
I am Ba'al.
That's it? Just… ball? As in bocce?
I don't know the meaning of the word. Seriously, 'impudence,' what does that mean?
I agreed to let the Tok'ra put a snake in my head or I would have died. Right now I'm kinda wishing I had.
Do you not know the pain you will suffer for this impudence?
A wish easily granted.
Though a candle burns in my house there’s nobody home.
So you wanna be my Oma?
You could put it that way. I wouldn’t, but maybe that’s just me.
Jack, Abydos is in trouble. Anubis is on his way. He’s after the Eye of Ra.
I was sure that was an aspirin I took this morning.
Jack, it's me. It's really me. You have to help—find the Eye of Ra before Anubis does.
Hey Daniel. How're you doing? Long time. How are things on the higher planes?
Long time no see. How are you doing?
Fine. Just fine.

Actually a funny thing happened to me today. I'm riding an elevator and an old friend—someone who never calls, never writes—just shows up and tells me all about this very important and apparently urgent mission that needs my attention.
What is he now?
I assume you know about the part where you don’t kill us.
You weren't using it anymore.
Surrender or die!
I was just gonna say the exact same thing.
O'Neill. Of SG-1.
Hey, how’re you doing? You’ll have to forgive me, I'm terrible with names. What was—?
I am Herak.
Congratulations. Failing upwards, I see.
Yes. You do that. Don’t forget to tell him you screwed up again.
Do something or we walk. Right now.
Cross it.
We changed the way things played out, which would seem to indicate the future isn't predetermined. But by doing so we fulfilled an ancient prophecy.
Maybe it was just a lucky guess.
So you're seeing things before they happen.
That's right.
Like what's for lunch.
We have encountered many strange phenomenon, Jonas Quinn, but I have yet to meet anyone who can see the future.
It goes against all the laws of physics as we understand them.
It's hard to believe that Yu hasn't been destroyed yet.
Given that he is the only System Lord still in opposition to Anubis, his persistence is remarkable.
You go, Yu!
You know every time I wake up in a Goa'uld cell, I can't help the thought that something bad's gonna happen.
You are the Tau'ri of Stargate Command.
And you... are Lord Mot – here to punish us for our insolence, etc., yada, et al.
So no lottery numbers? No trip to Vegas, just you and me.
Nirrti is most interested in creating the perfect human host in order to increase her power.
So. She's at it again.
No, sir. This is worse.
Sam's right. Up to now, Nirrti's been using eugenics.
With a machine that can alter DNA and a population with which to experiment, Nirrti could create a new host or even alter the DNA of her current one.
A Goa'uld with the powers of a Hok'tar.
Like it or not, a Russian team is operating out of the SGC. I've been asked to integrate them more fully into our own operations.
Does it have to be with my team?
Lieutenant Colonel Evanov is a fine officer. I assure you, you'll be in command.
Yes sir. I'll remind him of that.
Those few thousand years on another planet have changed you more than you know.
Once I share those powers we could rule the galaxy. Together.
Well that is... definitely the most interesting offer I've had in a very long time. But you can't risk giving me those kind of powers unless you're certain I won't use them against you.
What about everyone else?
Unnecessary.
What would I do? I'd free my friends and all the other people you have caged up down there. And then I would destroy you. Not necessarily in that order, but you get the idea.
Hail Dorothy, the wicked witch is dead.
To Oz? It's... part of that movie.
To tell you the truth, sir, I didn't know what to say. She caught me completely off-guard.
You did the right thing, Major. Our official policy is to deny everything.
Unfortunately in this case I don't think it's going to be enough.
Colonel, you either give me what I need and we make arrangements, or we make a U-turn and I take you right back to your box.

Seems to me that you're in a bit of a bind now, aren't you? Fortunately for you, I am willing to board the X-303 in the interest of saving lives. Of course I'm going to need a change of clothes. Something nice.
Okay. Let's go home.
If I don't know where we are, I can't plot a course for home.
How does that help us?
Ah, it doesn't.
Can you help us out here?
It is in fact we who need your help. The Asgard home world has been overrun by replicators. We have need of both you and your ship.
